TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed FieldAttributes extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies flags that describe the attributes of a field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `FieldAttributes` uses the value from `FieldAccessMask` to mask off only the parts of the attribute value that pertain to the accessibility. For example, the following code determines if `Attributes` has the public bit set.
[!code-cpp[System.Reflection.FieldAttributes#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.reflection.fiel_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Reflection.FieldAttributes#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.reflection.fiel_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Reflection.FieldAttributes#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.reflection.fiel_0_1.vb)]
To get the `FieldAttributes`, first get the class `Type`. From the `Type`, get the `FieldInfo`. From the `FieldInfo`, get the `Attributes`.
The enumerated value is a number representing the bitwise OR of the attributes implemented on the field.
## Examples In this example, three fields are built and the `FieldAttributes` values are displayed. A `FieldAttributes` value can contain more than one attribute, for example, both `Public` and `Literal`, as shown in the third field.
[!code-cs[Classic FieldAttributes Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.reflection.fiel_0_2.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic FieldAttributes Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.reflection.fiel_0_2.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic FieldAttributes Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.reflection.fiel_0_2.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Assembly = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is accessible throughout the assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes FamANDAssem = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is accessible only by subtypes in this assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Family = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is accessible only by type and subtypes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes FamORAssem = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is accessible by subtypes anywhere, as well as throughout this assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes FieldAccessMask = int32(7)

Docs.summary: Specifies the access level of a given field.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes HasDefault = int32(32768)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field has a default value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes HasFieldMarshal = int32(4096)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field has marshaling information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes HasFieldRVA = int32(256)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field has a relative virtual address (RVA). The RVA is the location of the method body in the current image, as an address relative to the start of the image file in which it is located.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes InitOnly = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is initialized only, and can be set only in the body of a constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Literal = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field's value is a compile-time (static or early bound) constant. Any attempt to set it throws a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes NotSerialized = int32(128)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field does not have to be serialized when the type is remoted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes PinvokeImpl = int32(8192)

Docs.summary: Reserved for future use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Private = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is accessible only by the parent type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes PrivateScope = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field cannot be referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Public = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field is accessible by any member for whom this scope is visible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes ReservedMask = int32(38144)

Docs.summary: Reserved.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes RTSpecialName = int32(1024)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the common language runtime (metadata internal APIs) should check the name encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes SpecialName = int32(512)

Docs.summary: Specifies a special method, with the name describing how the method is special.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Static = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the field represents the defined type, or else it is per-instance.
